newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee fell 0.10 to 39.10 to the dollar at close in the kerb market on Wednesday and is likely to open lower on Thursday amid a rise in demand for dollars, dealers said.
They said higher demand for the dollar ahead of the Friday weekend was likely to keep the rupee under pressure.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on August 13, was 35.5300/35.7077 to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 9.80 percent from its previuos close at 9.60 percent.
